alert.note: Alert for Coke; Sterling (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 10 at 7:51PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Coke, Sterling, northwestern Tom Green and northern Irion Counties through 845 PM CDT... At 750 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles southeast of Saint Lawrence, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Sterling City, Broome, Water Valley and Us-87 Near The Coke- Tom Green County Line. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for west central Texas.
